learning_outcomes.description: describe and compute fundamental properties of a curve, such as curvature and torsion
understand, calculate and use properties such as first and second fundamental form of surfaces in 3-space
understand various ways in which calculus on flat spaces can be extended to calculus on curved spaces
compute the mean and Gauss curvature of a surface in 3-space
both describe geometrically what it means to differentiate along a surface and be able to compute this; in particular, to find geodesics on a given surface
give examples of special types of surfaces, such as minimal surfaces, and analyse their properties
understand and use major theorems such as the Gauss-Bonnet theorem, that describe the global geometry of a surface in terms of its topology
define and compute integrals over manifolds

assessments.task_description:
There will be six assignments. Each one will comprise roughly 3 to 4 problems on course material recently covered. 

The best 5 out of 6 marks from your assignments, equally weighted, will be used in determining your final assignment mark (a number between 0 and 100).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments will be submitted electronically in Blackboard. Submissions in LaTEX are strongly encouraged.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
